archetype_name: Family Extra-Hot Chili Night (Caribbean & Mexican, 15–30, Simple)
name: Extra-Hot Habanero Chicken & Black Bean Roti Wraps
description: Fiery grilled chicken tossed with habanero and ghost chilli, folded into warm roti with a quick black bean–pepper mix and fresh lime. Caribbean heat meets Mexican street-wrap speed.
prep_steps: Thinly slice chicken thighs into bite-size strips.
Slice bell peppers into thin strips and onion into thin wedges.
Finely chop garlic and roughly chop coriander (leaves and tender stems).
Finely mince ghost chilli (use gloves) and cut limes into wedges.
In a bowl, toss chicken with habanero sauce, ground cumin, a big pinch of salt, and 1 tbsp olive oil.
Preheat an outdoor grill (medium-high) or a large stovetop pan/skillet over medium-high heat.
Set roti, salsa, and avocado (sliced) ready for assembly.
cook_steps: Grill or pan-sear the chicken in a single layer until charred and cooked through, 6–8 minutes, tossing once. Transfer to a bowl.
Add 1 tbsp olive oil to the pan. Sauté onion and bell peppers with garlic and the minced ghost chilli for 3–4 minutes until crisp-tender.
Stir in black beans and a pinch of salt; cook 1–2 minutes to warm through. Return chicken to the pan and toss to combine. Squeeze in 1 lime wedge and adjust salt.
Warm roti on the grill or dry pan 15–30 seconds per side.
Assemble wraps: layer chicken-bean-pepper mix on roti, top with coriander, avocado slices, and spoonfuls of salsa. Add extra habanero sauce if desired.
Serve with remaining lime wedges for squeezing.
